intro: Cleistanthus monocarpus, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riverine forests and gallery woodlands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
